text: Trevor Wallace Howard-Smith (29 September 1913 â€“ 7 January 1988)Pettigrew Trevor Howard: A Personal Biography, London: Peter Owen, 2001, p. 26 and p. 245 was an English actor. He was born in Cliftonville, Kent. He was known for his roles in Brief Encounter (1945), followed by The Third Man (1949). He studied at the Royal Academy of Dramatic Art. He declined a CBE in 1982. He won a BAFTA Award in 1959 and an Emmy Award in 1963. Howard died on 7 January 1988 from liver failure complicated by cirrhosis in Arkley, Barnet, aged 74.Pettigrew Trevor Howard: A Personal Biography, London: Peter Owen, 2001, p. 245 ==References== ==Other websites== * * Trevor Howard papers archived at Bristol University * Category:BAFTA Award winning actors Category:Emmy Award winning actors Category:1913 births Category:1988 deaths Category:Deaths from liver failure Category:Deaths from cirrhosis Category:Disease-related deaths in England Category:English movie actors Category:English television actors Category:English radio actors Category:English stage actors Category:Actors from Kent
